properties.name: request_write_access
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in [Receiving authorization data](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#receiving-authorization-data).NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in [Checking authorization](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#checking-authorization).

MaskPosition.name: MaskPosition
MaskPosition.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

properties.name: point
properties.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

properties.name: x_shift
properties.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

properties.name: y_shift
properties.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

properties.name: audio
properties.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice, 0-1024 characters

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

properties.name: channel_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Conversation the message belongs to

properties.name: connected_website
properties.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. [More about Telegram Login »](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login)

properties.name: contact
properties.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: delete_chat_photo
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

properties.name: document
properties.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

properties.name: edit_date
properties.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

properties.name: entities
properties.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

properties.name: forward_date
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: forward_from
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

properties.name: forward_from_chat
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

properties.name: forward_from_message_id
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

properties.name: forward_sender_name
properties.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

properties.name: forward_signature
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, signature of the post author if present

properties.name: from
properties.description: Optional. Sender, empty for messages sent to channels

properties.name: game
properties.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. [More about games »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games)

properties.name: group_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

properties.name: invoice
properties.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a [payment](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments), information about the invoice. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments)

properties.name: left_chat_member
properties.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

properties.name: media_group_id
properties.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

properties.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

properties.name: migrate_from_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: new_chat_members
properties.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

properties.name: new_chat_photo
properties.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

properties.name: new_chat_title
properties.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

properties.name: passport_data
properties.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

properties.name: poll
properties.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

properties.name: proximity_alert_triggered
properties.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

properties.name: reply_to_message
properties.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: sender_chat
properties.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. The channel itself for channel messages. The supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators. The linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

properties.name: successful_payment
properties.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments)

properties.name: supergroup_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message, 0-4096 characters

properties.name: venue
properties.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

properties.name: via_bot
properties.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

properties.name: video
properties.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

properties.name: video_note
properties.description: Optional. Message is a [video note](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope), information about the video message

properties.name: voice
properties.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

properties.name: voice_chat_ended
properties.description: Optional. Service message: voice chat ended

properties.name: voice_chat_participants_invited
properties.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a voice chat

properties.name: voice_chat_scheduled
properties.description: Optional. Service message: voice chat scheduled

properties.name: voice_chat_started
properties.description: Optional. Service message: voice chat started

MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat

MessageEntity.name: MessageEntity
MessageEntity.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

properties.name: language
properties.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the entity. Can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users [without usernames](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/edit#new-mentions))

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, url that will be opened after user taps on the text

properties.name: user
properties.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

MessageId.name: MessageId
MessageId.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier

OrderInfo.name: OrderInfo
OrderInfo.description: This object represents information about an order.

properties.name: email
properties.description: Optional. User email

properties.name: name
properties.description: Optional. User name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Optional. User's phone number

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: Optional. User shipping address

PassportData.name: PassportData
PassportData.description: Contains information about Telegram Passport data shared with the bot by the user.

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data

properties.name: data
properties.description: Array with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that was shared with the bot

PassportElementError.name: PassportElementError
PassportElementError.description:
This object represents an error in the Telegram Passport element which was submitted that should be resolved by the user. It should be one of:

- [PassportElementErrorDataField](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrordatafield)
- [PassportElementErrorFrontSide](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorfrontside)
- [PassportElementErrorReverseSide](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorreverseside)
- [PassportElementErrorSelfie](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorselfie)
- [PassportElementErrorFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorfile)
- [PassportElementErrorFiles](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorfiles)
- [PassportElementErrorTranslationFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrortranslationfile)
- [PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrortranslationfiles)
- [PassportElementErrorUnspecified](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorunspecified)

PassportElementErrorDataField.name: PassportElementErrorDataField
PassportElementErrorDataField.description: Represents an issue in one of the data fields that was provided by the user. The error is considered resolved when the field's value changes.

properties.name: data_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded data hash

properties.name: field_name
properties.description: Name of the data field which has the error

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be data

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the error, one of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”

PassportElementErrorFile.name: PassportElementErrorFile
PassportElementErrorFile.description: Represents an issue with a document scan. The error is considered resolved when the file with the document scan changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded file hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be file

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorFiles.name: PassportElementErrorFiles
PassportElementErrorFiles.description: Represents an issue with a list of scans. The error is considered resolved when the list of files containing the scans changes.

properties.name: file_hashes
properties.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be files

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorFrontSide.name: PassportElementErrorFrontSide
PassportElementErrorFrontSide.description: Represents an issue with the front side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the front side of the document changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the front side of the document

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be front_side

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

PassportElementErrorReverseSide.name: PassportElementErrorReverseSide
PassportElementErrorReverseSide.description: Represents an issue with the reverse side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with reverse side of the document changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the reverse side of the document

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be reverse_side

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “driver_license”, “identity_card”

PassportElementErrorSelfie.name: PassportElementErrorSelfie
PassportElementErrorSelfie.description: Represents an issue with the selfie with a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the selfie changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the selfie

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be selfie

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

PassportElementErrorTranslationFile.name: PassportElementErrorTranslationFile
PassportElementErrorTranslationFile.description: Represents an issue with one of the files that constitute the translation of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded file hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be translation_file

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles.name: PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles
PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles.description: Represents an issue with the translated version of a document. The error is considered resolved when a file with the document translation change.

properties.name: file_hashes
properties.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be translation_files

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorUnspecified.name: PassportElementErrorUnspecified
PassportElementErrorUnspecified.description: Represents an issue in an unspecified place. The error is considered resolved when new data is added.

properties.name: element_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded element hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be unspecified

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue

PassportFile.name: PassportFile
PassportFile.description: This object represents a file uploaded to Telegram Passport. Currently all Telegram Passport files are in JPEG format when decrypted and don't exceed 10MB.

properties.name: file_date
properties.description: Unix time when the file was uploaded

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: File size

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

PhotoSize.name: PhotoSize
PhotoSize.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a [file](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#document) / [sticker](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sticker) thumbnail.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Photo height

properties.name: width
properties.description: Photo width

Poll.name: Poll
Poll.description: This object contains information about a poll.

properties.name: allows_multiple_answers
properties.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

properties.name: close_date
properties.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

properties.name: correct_option_id
properties.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

properties.name: explanation
properties.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

properties.name: explanation_entities
properties.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

properties.name: is_closed
properties.description: True, if the poll is closed

properties.name: open_period
properties.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

properties.name: options
properties.description: List of poll options

properties.name: question
properties.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

properties.name: total_voter_count
properties.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

properties.name: type
properties.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

PollAnswer.name: PollAnswer
PollAnswer.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

properties.name: option_ids
properties.description: 0-based identifiers of answer options, chosen by the user. May be empty if the user retracted their vote.

properties.name: poll_id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: user
properties.description: The user, who changed the answer to the poll

PollOption.name: PollOption
PollOption.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

properties.name: voter_count
properties.description: Number of users that voted for this option

PreCheckoutQuery.name: PreCheckoutQuery
PreCheckoutQuery.description: This object contains information about an incoming pre-checkout query.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who sent the query

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique query identifier

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot specified invoice payload

properties.name: order_info
properties.description: Optional. Order info provided by the user

properties.name: shipping_option_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

ProximityAlertTriggered.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
ProximityAlertTriggered.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance between the users

properties.name: traveler
properties.description: User that triggered the alert

properties.name: watcher
properties.description: User that set the alert

ReplyKeyboardMarkup.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
ReplyKeyboardMarkup.description: This object represents a [custom keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards) with reply options (see [Introduction to bots](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards) for details and examples).

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [KeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#keyboardbutton) objects

properties.name: one_time_keyboard
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat – the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

properties.name: resize_keyboard
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

ReplyKeyboardRemove.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
ReplyKeyboardRemove.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#replykeyboardmarkup)).

properties.name: remove_keyboard
properties.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#replykeyboardmarkup))

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

ResponseParameters.name: ResponseParameters
ResponseParameters.description: Contains information about why a request was unsuccessful.

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: retry_after
properties.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

ShippingAddress.name: ShippingAddress
ShippingAddress.description: This object represents a shipping address.

properties.name: city
properties.description: City

properties.name: country_code
properties.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

properties.name: post_code
properties.description: Address post code

properties.name: state
properties.description: State, if applicable

properties.name: street_line1
properties.description: First line for the address

properties.name: street_line2
properties.description: Second line for the address

ShippingOption.name: ShippingOption
ShippingOption.description: This object represents one shipping option.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Shipping option identifier

properties.name: prices
properties.description: List of price portions

properties.name: title
properties.description: Option title

ShippingQuery.name: ShippingQuery
ShippingQuery.description: This object contains information about an incoming shipping query.

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who sent the query

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique query identifier

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot specified invoice payload

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: User specified shipping address

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Optional. Emoji associated with the sticker

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sticker height

properties.name: is_animated
properties.description: True, if the sticker is [animated](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers)

properties.name: mask_position
properties.description: Optional. For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

properties.name: set_name
properties.description: Optional. Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sticker width

StickerSet.name: StickerSet
StickerSet.description: This object represents a sticker set.

properties.name: contains_masks
properties.description: True, if the sticker set contains masks

properties.name: is_animated
properties.description: True, if the sticker set contains [animated stickers](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers)

properties.name: name
properties.description: Sticker set name

properties.name: stickers
properties.description: List of all set stickers

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP or .TGS format

properties.name: title
properties.description: Sticker set title

SuccessfulPayment.name: SuccessfulPayment
SuccessfulPayment.description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot specified invoice payload

properties.name: order_info
properties.description: Optional. Order info provided by the user

properties.name: provider_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Provider payment identifier

properties.name: shipping_option_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

properties.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Telegram payment identifier

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

Update.name: Update
Update.description: This [object](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#available-types) represents an incoming update.At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

properties.name: callback_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

properties.name: channel_post
properties.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: chat_member
properties.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

properties.name: chosen_inline_result
properties.description: Optional. The result of an [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inline-mode) query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the [feedback collecting](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline#collecting-feedback) for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

properties.name: edited_channel_post
properties.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: edited_message
properties.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: inline_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inline-mode) query

properties.name: message
properties.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: my_chat_member
properties.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

properties.name: poll
properties.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

properties.name: poll_answer
properties.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

properties.name: pre_checkout_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

properties.name: shipping_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

properties.name: update_id
properties.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you're using [Webhooks](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#setwebhook), since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

User.name: User
User.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

properties.name: can_join_groups
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme).

properties.name: can_read_all_group_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if [privacy mode](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#privacy-mode) is disabled for the bot. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme).

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: User's or bot's first name

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: is_bot
properties.description: True, if this user is a bot

properties.name: language_code
properties.description: Optional. [IETF language tag](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) of the user's language

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

properties.name: supports_inline_queries
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme).

properties.name: username
properties.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

UserProfilePhotos.name: UserProfilePhotos
UserProfilePhotos.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

properties.name: photos
properties.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

properties.name: location
properties.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

properties.name: title
properties.description: Name of the venue

Video.name: Video
Video.description: This object represents a video file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. Mime type of a file as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by sender

VideoNote.name: VideoNote
VideoNote.description: This object represents a [video message](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope) (available in Telegram apps as of [v.4.0](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope)).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

Voice.name: Voice
Voice.description: This object represents a voice note.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

VoiceChatEnded.name: VoiceChatEnded
VoiceChatEnded.description: This object represents a service message about a voice chat ended in the chat.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Voice chat duration; in seconds

VoiceChatParticipantsInvited.name: VoiceChatParticipantsInvited
VoiceChatParticipantsInvited.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a voice chat.

properties.name: users
properties.description: Optional. New members that were invited to the voice chat

VoiceChatScheduled.name: VoiceChatScheduled
VoiceChatScheduled.description: This object represents a service message about a voice chat scheduled in the chat.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the voice chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

VoiceChatStarted.name: VoiceChatStarted
VoiceChatStarted.description: This object represents a service message about a voice chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

WebhookInfo.name: WebhookInfo
WebhookInfo.description: Contains information about the current status of a webhook.

properties.name: allowed_updates
properties.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

properties.name: has_custom_certificate
properties.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address

properties.name: last_error_date
properties.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_error_message
properties.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: max_connections
properties.description: Optional. Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

properties.name: pending_update_count
properties.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

properties.name: url
properties.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

addStickerToSet.name: addStickerToSet
addStickerToSet.description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. You must use exactly one of the fields png_sticker or tgs_sticker. Animated stickers can be added to animated sticker sets and only to them. Animated sticker sets can have up to 50 stickers. Static sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: emojis
arguments.description: One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker

arguments.name: mask_position
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: png_sticker
arguments.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: tgs_sticker
arguments.description: TGS animation with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See [](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements)[https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements) for technical requirements

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

answerCallbackQuery.name: answerCallbackQuery
answerCallbackQuery.description: Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from [inline keyboards](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating). The answer will be displayed to the user as a notification at the top of the chat screen or as an alert. On success, True is returned.

arguments.name: cache_time
arguments.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the callback query may be cached client-side. Telegram apps will support caching starting in version 3.14. Defaults to 0.

arguments.name: callback_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: show_alert
arguments.description: If true, an alert will be shown by the client instead of a notification at the top of the chat screen. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Text of the notification. If not specified, nothing will be shown to the user, 0-200 characters

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: URL that will be opened by the user's client. If you have created a [Game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#game) and accepted the conditions via [@Botfather](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://t.me/botfather), specify the URL that opens your game — note that this will only work if the query comes from a [callback_game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinekeyboardbutton) button.Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

answerInlineQuery.name: answerInlineQuery
answerInlineQuery.description: Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

arguments.name: cache_time
arguments.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

arguments.name: inline_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

arguments.name: is_personal
arguments.description: Pass True, if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query

arguments.name: next_offset
arguments.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

arguments.name: results
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

arguments.name: switch_pm_parameter
arguments.description: [Deep-linking](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#deep-linking) parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when user presses the switch button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an oauth link. Once done, the bot can offer a [switch_inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinekeyboardmarkup) button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

arguments.name: switch_pm_text
arguments.description: If passed, clients will display a button with specified text that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with the parameter switch_pm_parameter

answerPreCheckoutQuery.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
answerPreCheckoutQuery.description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update) with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

arguments.name: error_message
arguments.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

arguments.name: ok
arguments.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

arguments.name: pre_checkout_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

answerShippingQuery.name: answerShippingQuery
answerShippingQuery.description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update) with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

arguments.name: error_message
arguments.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable'). Telegram will display this message to the user.

arguments.name: ok
arguments.description: Specify True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

arguments.name: shipping_options
arguments.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

arguments.name: shipping_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

close.name: close
close.description: Use this method to close the bot instance before moving it from one local server to another. You need to delete the webhook before calling this method to ensure that the bot isn't launched again after server restart. The method will return error 429 in the first 10 minutes after the bot is launched. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

copyMessage.name: copyMessage
copyMessage.description: Use this method to copy messages of any kind. Service messages and invoice messages can't be copied. The method is analogous to the method [forwardMessage](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#forwardmessage), but the copied message doesn't have a link to the original message. Returns the [MessageId](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#messageid) of the sent message on success.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: New caption for media, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. If not specified, the original caption is kept

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the new caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: from_chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the chat where the original message was sent (or channel username in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Message identifier in the chat specified in from_chat_id

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the new caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

createChatInviteLink.name: createChatInviteLink
createChatInviteLink.description: Use this method to create an additional invite link for a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. The link can be revoked using the method [revokeChatInviteLink](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#revokechatinvitelink). Returns the new invite link as [ChatInviteLink](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatinvitelink) object.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: expire_date
arguments.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire

arguments.name: member_limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

createNewStickerSet.name: createNewStickerSet
createNewStickerSet.description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. You must use exactly one of the fields png_sticker or tgs_sticker. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: contains_masks
arguments.description: Pass True, if a set of mask stickers should be created

arguments.name: emojis
arguments.description: One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker

arguments.name: mask_position
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only english letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in “_by_<bot username>”. <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

arguments.name: png_sticker
arguments.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: tgs_sticker
arguments.description: TGS animation with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See [](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements)[https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements) for technical requirements

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

deleteChatPhoto.name: deleteChatPhoto
deleteChatPhoto.description: Use this method to delete a chat photo. Photos can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

deleteChatStickerSet.name: deleteChatStickerSet
deleteChatStickerSet.description: Use this method to delete a group sticker set from a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat) requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

deleteMessage.name: deleteMessage
deleteMessage.description: Use this method to delete a message, including service messages, with the following limitations:- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.- A dice message in a private chat can only be deleted if it was sent more than 24 hours ago.- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.- If the bot has can_delete_messages permission in a supergroup or a channel, it can delete any message there.Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Identifier of the message to delete

deleteStickerFromSet.name: deleteStickerFromSet
deleteStickerFromSet.description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

deleteWebhook.name: deleteWebhook
deleteWebhook.description: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to [getUpdates](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getupdates). Returns True on success.

arguments.name: drop_pending_updates
arguments.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

editChatInviteLink.name: editChatInviteLink
editChatInviteLink.description: Use this method to edit a non-primary invite link created by the bot. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns the edited invite link as a [ChatInviteLink](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatinvitelink) object.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: expire_date
arguments.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire

arguments.name: invite_link
arguments.description: The invite link to edit

arguments.name: member_limit
arguments.description: Maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

editMessageCaption.name: editMessageCaption
editMessageCaption.description: Use this method to edit captions of messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: New caption of the message, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

editMessageLiveLocation.name: editMessageLiveLocation
editMessageLiveLocation.description: Use this method to edit live location messages. A location can be edited until its live_period expires or editing is explicitly disabled by a call to [stopMessageLiveLocation](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#stopmessagelivelocation). On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: heading
arguments.description: Direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

arguments.name: horizontal_accuracy
arguments.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: latitude
arguments.description: Latitude of new location

arguments.name: longitude
arguments.description: Longitude of new location

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

arguments.name: proximity_alert_radius
arguments.description: Maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

editMessageMedia.name: editMessageMedia
editMessageMedia.description: Use this method to edit animation, audio, document, photo, or video messages. If a message is part of a message album, then it can be edited only to an audio for audio albums, only to a document for document albums and to a photo or a video otherwise. When an inline message is edited, a new file can't be uploaded. Use a previously uploaded file via its file_id or specify a URL. On success, if the edited message was sent by the bot, the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: media
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new media content of the message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

editMessageReplyMarkup.name: editMessageReplyMarkup
editMessageReplyMarkup.description: Use this method to edit only the reply markup of messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

editMessageText.name: editMessageText
editMessageText.description: Use this method to edit text and [game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games) messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_web_page_preview
arguments.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

arguments.name: entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: New text of the message, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

exportChatInviteLink.name: exportChatInviteLink
exportChatInviteLink.description: Use this method to generate a new primary invite link for a chat; any previously generated primary link is revoked. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns the new invite link as String on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

forwardMessage.name: forwardMessage
forwardMessage.description: Use this method to forward messages of any kind. Service messages can't be forwarded. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: from_chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the chat where the original message was sent (or channel username in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Message identifier in the chat specified in from_chat_id

getChat.name: getChat
getChat.description: Use this method to get up to date information about the chat (current name of the user for one-on-one conversations, current username of a user, group or channel, etc.). Returns a [Chat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chat) object on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

getChatAdministrators.name: getChatAdministrators
getChatAdministrators.description: Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat. On success, returns an Array of [ChatMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) objects that contains information about all chat administrators except other bots. If the chat is a group or a supergroup and no administrators were appointed, only the creator will be returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

getChatMember.name: getChatMember
getChatMember.description: Use this method to get information about a member of a chat. Returns a [ChatMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) object on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

getChatMembersCount.name: getChatMembersCount
getChatMembersCount.description: Use this method to get the number of members in a chat. Returns Int on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

getFile.name: getFile
getFile.description:
Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading. For the moment, bots can download files of up to 20MB in size. On success, a [File](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#file) object is returned. The file can then be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>, where <file_path> is taken from the response. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling [getFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getfile) again.
Note: This function may not preserve the original file name and MIME type. You should save the file's MIME type and name (if available) when the File object is received.

arguments.name: file_id
arguments.description: File identifier to get info about

getGameHighScores.name: getGameHighScores
getGameHighScores.description: Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of their neighbors in a game. On success, returns an Array of [GameHighScore](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#gamehighscore) objects.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Target user id

getMe.name: getMe
getMe.description: A simple method for testing your bot's auth token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a [User](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#user) object.

getMyCommands.name: getMyCommands
getMyCommands.description: Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands. Requires no parameters. Returns Array of [BotCommand](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommand) on success.

getStickerSet.name: getStickerSet
getStickerSet.description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a [StickerSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#stickerset) object is returned.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Name of the sticker set

getUpdates.name: getUpdates
getUpdates.description: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling ([wiki](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Push_technology#Long_polling)). An Array of [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update) objects is returned.

arguments.name: allowed_updates
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update) for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as [getUpdates](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getupdates) is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will forgotten.

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

getUserProfilePhotos.name: getUserProfilePhotos
getUserProfilePhotos.description: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a [UserProfilePhotos](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#userprofilephotos) object.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: Limits the number of photos to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: Sequential number of the first photo to be returned. By default, all photos are returned.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

getWebhookInfo.name: getWebhookInfo
getWebhookInfo.description: Use this method to get current webhook status. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a [WebhookInfo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#webhookinfo) object. If the bot is using [getUpdates](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getupdates), will return an object with the url field empty.

kickChatMember.name: kickChatMember
kickChatMember.description: Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel. In the case of supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to return to the chat on their own using invite links, etc., unless [unbanned](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#unbanchatmember) first. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: revoke_messages
arguments.description: Pass True to delete all messages from the chat for the user that is being removed. If False, the user will be able to see messages in the group that were sent before the user was removed. Always True for supergroups and channels.

arguments.name: until_date
arguments.description: Date when the user will be unbanned, unix time. If user is banned for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time they are considered to be banned forever. Applied for supergroups and channels only.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

leaveChat.name: leaveChat
