leaveChat.description: Use this method for your bot to leave a group, supergroup or channel. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

logOut.name: logOut
logOut.description: Use this method to log out from the cloud Bot API server before launching the bot locally. You must log out the bot before running it locally, otherwise there is no guarantee that the bot will receive updates. After a successful call, you can immediately log in on a local server, but will not be able to log in back to the cloud Bot API server for 10 minutes. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

pinChatMessage.name: pinChatMessage
pinChatMessage.description: Use this method to add a message to the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' admin right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' admin right in a channel. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Pass True, if it is not necessary to send a notification to all chat members about the new pinned message. Notifications are always disabled in channels and private chats.

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Identifier of a message to pin

promoteChatMember.name: promoteChatMember
promoteChatMember.description: Use this method to promote or demote a user in a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Pass False for all boolean parameters to demote a user. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: can_change_info
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can change chat title, photo and other settings

arguments.name: can_delete_messages
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

arguments.name: can_edit_messages
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages, channels only

arguments.name: can_invite_users
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can invite new users to the chat

arguments.name: can_manage_chat
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

arguments.name: can_manage_voice_chats
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can manage voice chats

arguments.name: can_pin_messages
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can pin messages, supergroups only

arguments.name: can_post_messages
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can create channel posts, channels only

arguments.name: can_promote_members
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that he has promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by him)

arguments.name: can_restrict_members
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: is_anonymous
arguments.description: Pass True, if the administrator's presence in the chat is hidden

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

restrictChatMember.name: restrictChatMember
restrictChatMember.description: Use this method to restrict a user in a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the supergroup for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Pass True for all permissions to lift restrictions from a user. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: permissions
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for new user permissions

arguments.name: until_date
arguments.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for the user, unix time. If user is restricted for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time, they are considered to be restricted forever

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

revokeChatInviteLink.name: revokeChatInviteLink
revokeChatInviteLink.description: Use this method to revoke an invite link created by the bot. If the primary link is revoked, a new link is automatically generated. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns the revoked invite link as [ChatInviteLink](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatinvitelink) object.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: invite_link
arguments.description: The invite link to revoke

sendAnimation.name: sendAnimation
sendAnimation.description: Use this method to send animation files (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound). On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned. Bots can currently send animation files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: animation
arguments.description: Animation to send. Pass a file_id as String to send an animation that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get an animation from the Internet, or upload a new animation using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: Animation caption (may also be used when resending animation by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: Duration of sent animation in seconds

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Animation height

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the animation caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: thumb
arguments.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Animation width

sendAudio.name: sendAudio
sendAudio.description:
Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display them in the music player. Your audio must be in the .MP3 or .M4A format. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned. Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
For sending voice messages, use the [sendVoice](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendvoice) method instead.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: audio
arguments.description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send an audio file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get an audio file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: Audio caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: Duration of the audio in seconds

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: performer
arguments.description: Performer

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: thumb
arguments.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Track name

sendChatAction.name: sendChatAction
sendChatAction.description:
Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status). Returns True on success.
We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a noticeable amount of time to arrive.

arguments.name: action
arguments.description: Type of action to broadcast. Choose one, depending on what the user is about to receive: typing for [text messages](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendmessage), upload_photo for [photos](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendphoto), record_video or upload_video for [videos](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendvideo), record_voice or upload_voice for [voice notes](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendvoice), upload_document for [general files](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#senddocument), find_location for [location data](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendlocation), record_video_note or upload_video_note for [video notes](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendvideonote).

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

sendContact.name: sendContact
sendContact.description: Use this method to send phone contacts. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: first_name
arguments.description: Contact's first name

arguments.name: last_name
arguments.description: Contact's last name

arguments.name: phone_number
arguments.description: Contact's phone number

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: vcard
arguments.description: Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard), 0-2048 bytes

sendDice.name: sendDice
sendDice.description: Use this method to send an animated emoji that will display a random value. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: emoji
arguments.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based. Currently, must be one of “”, “”, “”, “”, “”, or “”. Dice can have values 1-6 for “”, “” and “”, values 1-5 for “” and “”, and values 1-64 for “”. Defaults to “”

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

sendDocument.name: sendDocument
sendDocument.description: Use this method to send general files. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned. Bots can currently send files of any type of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: Document caption (may also be used when resending documents by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_content_type_detection
arguments.description: Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: document
arguments.description: File to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: thumb
arguments.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

sendGame.name: sendGame
sendGame.description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: game_short_name
arguments.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via [Botfather](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://t.me/botfather).

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating). If empty, one 'Play game_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

sendInvoice.name: sendInvoice
sendInvoice.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: currency
arguments.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see [more on currencies](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies)

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: is_flexible
arguments.description: Pass True, if the final price depends on the shipping method

arguments.name: max_tip_amount
arguments.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0

arguments.name: need_email
arguments.description: Pass True, if you require the user's email address to complete the order

arguments.name: need_name
arguments.description: Pass True, if you require the user's full name to complete the order

arguments.name: need_phone_number
arguments.description: Pass True, if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

arguments.name: need_shipping_address
arguments.description: Pass True, if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

arguments.name: payload
arguments.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

arguments.name: photo_height
arguments.description: Photo height

arguments.name: photo_size
arguments.description: Photo size

arguments.name: photo_url
arguments.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

arguments.name: photo_width
arguments.description: Photo width

arguments.name: prices
arguments.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

arguments.name: provider_data
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

arguments.name: provider_token
arguments.description: Payments provider token, obtained via [Botfather](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://t.me/botfather)

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating). If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: send_email_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass True, if user's email address should be sent to provider

arguments.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass True, if user's phone number should be sent to provider

arguments.name: start_parameter
arguments.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

arguments.name: suggested_tip_amounts
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

sendLocation.name: sendLocation
sendLocation.description: Use this method to send point on the map. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: heading
arguments.description: For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

arguments.name: horizontal_accuracy
arguments.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

arguments.name: latitude
arguments.description: Latitude of the location

arguments.name: live_period
arguments.description: Period in seconds for which the location will be updated (see [Live Locations](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/live-locations), should be between 60 and 86400.

arguments.name: longitude
arguments.description: Longitude of the location

arguments.name: proximity_alert_radius
arguments.description: For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

sendMediaGroup.name: sendMediaGroup
sendMediaGroup.description: Use this method to send a group of photos, videos, documents or audios as an album. Documents and audio files can be only grouped in an album with messages of the same type. On success, an array of [Messages](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) that were sent is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends messages [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: media
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array describing messages to be sent, must include 2-10 items

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the messages are a reply, ID of the original message

sendMessage.name: sendMessage
sendMessage.description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: disable_web_page_preview
arguments.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

arguments.name: entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

sendPhoto.name: sendPhoto
sendPhoto.description: Use this method to send photos. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: Photo caption (may also be used when resending photos by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: photo
arguments.description: Photo to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a photo that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a photo from the Internet, or upload a new photo using multipart/form-data. The photo must be at most 10 MB in size. The photo's width and height must not exceed 10000 in total. Width and height ratio must be at most 20. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

sendPoll.name: sendPoll
sendPoll.description: Use this method to send a native poll. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: allows_multiple_answers
arguments.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: close_date
arguments.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.

arguments.name: correct_option_id
arguments.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: explanation
arguments.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing

arguments.name: explanation_entities
arguments.description: List of special entities that appear in the poll explanation, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: explanation_parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: is_anonymous
arguments.description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True

arguments.name: is_closed
arguments.description: Pass True, if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.

arguments.name: open_period
arguments.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of answer options, 2-10 strings 1-100 characters each

arguments.name: question
arguments.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Poll type, “quiz” or “regular”, defaults to “regular”

sendSticker.name: sendSticker
sendSticker.description: Use this method to send static .WEBP or [animated](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers) .TGS stickers. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

sendVenue.name: sendVenue
sendVenue.description: Use this method to send information about a venue. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: address
arguments.description: Address of the venue

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: foursquare_id
arguments.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue

arguments.name: foursquare_type
arguments.description: Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

arguments.name: google_place_id
arguments.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

arguments.name: google_place_type
arguments.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

arguments.name: latitude
arguments.description: Latitude of the venue

arguments.name: longitude
arguments.description: Longitude of the venue

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating), [custom reply keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: voice
arguments.description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

setChatAdministratorCustomTitle.name: setChatAdministratorCustomTitle
setChatAdministratorCustomTitle.description: Use this method to set a custom title for an administrator in a supergroup promoted by the bot. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: custom_title
arguments.description: New custom title for the administrator; 0-16 characters, emoji are not allowed

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

setChatDescription.name: setChatDescription
setChatDescription.description: Use this method to change the description of a group, a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: New chat description, 0-255 characters

setChatPermissions.name: setChatPermissions
setChatPermissions.description: Use this method to set default chat permissions for all members. The bot must be an administrator in the group or a supergroup for this to work and must have the can_restrict_members admin rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: permissions
arguments.description: New default chat permissions

setChatPhoto.name: setChatPhoto
setChatPhoto.description: Use this method to set a new profile photo for the chat. Photos can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: photo
arguments.description: New chat photo, uploaded using multipart/form-data

setChatStickerSet.name: setChatStickerSet
setChatStickerSet.description: Use this method to set a new group sticker set for a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat) requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: sticker_set_name
arguments.description: Name of the sticker set to be set as the group sticker set

setChatTitle.name: setChatTitle
setChatTitle.description: Use this method to change the title of a chat. Titles can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: New chat title, 1-255 characters

setGameScore.name: setGameScore
setGameScore.description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game. On success, if the message was sent by the bot, returns the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message), otherwise returns True. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: disable_edit_message
arguments.description: Pass True, if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: Pass True, if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

arguments.name: score
arguments.description: New score, must be non-negative

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier

setMyCommands.name: setMyCommands
setMyCommands.description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: commands
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.

setPassportDataErrors.name: setPassportDataErrors
setPassportDataErrors.description:
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.
Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

arguments.name: errors
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier

setStickerPositionInSet.name: setStickerPositionInSet
setStickerPositionInSet.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

setStickerSetThumb.name: setStickerSetThumb
setStickerSetThumb.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a sticker set. Animated thumbnails can be set for animated sticker sets only. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: thumb
arguments.description: A PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have width and height exactly 100px, or a TGS animation with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see [](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements)[https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements) for animated sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files). Animated sticker set thumbnail can't be uploaded via HTTP URL.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

setWebhook.name: setWebhook
setWebhook.description:
Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update). In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.
If you'd like to make sure that the Webhook request comes from Telegram, we recommend using a secret path in the URL, e.g. https://www.example.com/<token>. Since nobody else knows your bot's token, you can be pretty sure it's us.

arguments.name: allowed_updates
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update) for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

arguments.name: certificate
arguments.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our [self-signed guide](https://core.telegram.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots/self-signed) for details.

arguments.name: drop_pending_updates
arguments.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

arguments.name: ip_address
arguments.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

arguments.name: max_connections
arguments.description: Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

stopMessageLiveLocation.name: stopMessageLiveLocation
stopMessageLiveLocation.description: Use this method to stop updating a live location message before live_period expires. On success, if the message was sent by the bot, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message with live location to stop

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

stopPoll.name: stopPoll
stopPoll.description: Use this method to stop a poll which was sent by the bot. On success, the stopped [Poll](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#poll) with the final results is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Identifier of the original message with the poll

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new message [inline keyboard](https://web.archive.org/web/20210618141913/https://core.telegram.org/bots#inline-keyboards-and-on-the-fly-updating).

unbanChatMember.name: unbanChatMember
unbanChatMember.description: Use this method to unban a previously kicked user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. By default, this method guarantees that after the call the user is not a member of the chat, but will be able to join it. So if the user is a member of the chat they will also be removed from the chat. If you don't want this, use the parameter only_if_banned. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @username)

arguments.name: only_if_banned
arguments.description: Do nothing if the user is not banned

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

unpinAllChatMessages.name: unpinAllChatMessages
unpinAllChatMessages.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' admin right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' admin right in a channel. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

unpinChatMessage.name: unpinChatMessage
unpinChatMessage.description: Use this method to remove a message from the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' admin right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' admin right in a channel. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Identifier of a message to unpin. If not specified, the most recent pinned message (by sending date) will be unpinned.

uploadStickerFile.name: uploadStickerFile
uploadStickerFile.description: Use this method to upload a .PNG file with a sticker for later use in createNewStickerSet and addStickerToSet methods (can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded [File](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#file) on success.

arguments.name: png_sticker
arguments.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. [More info on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of sticker file owner
